com.xtend.coap.message

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xtend.coap.message.Message
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Request, Response

    public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents a Message.
    Version:
    Xtend-CoAP_v1.0.
    Author:
    César Estebas Gómez.

      • readPayload

        public int readPayload(int pos)
        Reads the byte at the given position from the payload and blocks if the data is not yet available.
        Returns:
        The byte at the given position, or -1 if it does not exist

      • payloadSize

        public int payloadSize()

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        Checks whether the message is complete, i.e. its payload was completely received.
        Returns:
        True iff the message is complete

      • setComplete

        public void setComplete(boolean complete)
        Sets the complete flag of this message.
        Parameters:
        complete - The value of the complete flag

      • setTimestamp

        public void setTimestamp(long timestamp)
        Sets the timestamp associated with this message.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The new timestamp, in milliseconds

      • getTimestamp

        public long getTimestamp()
        Returns the timestamp associated with this message.
        Returns:
        The timestamp of the message, in milliseconds

      • completed

        public void completed()
        Notification method that is called when the message's complete flag changed to true. Subclasses may override this method to add custom handling code.

      • timedOut

        public void timedOut()
        Notification method that is called when the transmission of this message was cancelled due to timeout. Subclasses may override this method to add custom handling code.

      • payloadAppended

        public void payloadAppended(byte[] block)
        Notification method that is called whenever payload was appended using the appendPayload() method. Subclasses may override this method to add custom handling code.
        Parameters:
        block - A byte array containing the data that was appended

      • getBuddy

        public Message getBuddy()
        This function returns the buddy of this CoAP message Two messages are buddies iif they have the same message ID
        Returns:
        The buddy of the message, if any

      • endpointID

        public java.lang.String endpointID()

      • key

        public java.lang.String key()
        Returns a string that is assumed to uniquely identify a message Note that for incoming messages, the message ID is not sufficient as different remote endpoints may use the same message ID. Therefore, the message key includes the identifier of the sender next to the message id.
        Returns:
        A string identifying the message

                                throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException

        This method is overridden by subclasses according to the Visitor Pattern
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler for this message
